meanings.definition: To spread out or extend widely.
meanings.sent1: She did not want to disspread the blanket on the grass.
meanings.sent2: The map will disspread across the table for everyone to see.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to disspread its paws to catch the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The news of the party disspread quickly through the school.
meanings.sent5: The flowers disspread their petals in the morning sun.

meanings.definition: To be spread out or extended widely.
meanings.sent1: The colors of the sunset will disspread across the sky.
meanings.sent2: The picnic blanket disspread under the shady tree.
meanings.sent3: The giggles from the children disspread through the park.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly baked bread disspread through the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The joy disspread among the crowd as the parade passed by.
